attributes.action: Prevent the extradition of Mr Julian Assange to the United States
attributes.additional_details: Mr Assange now faces court proceedings in the UK that could result in extradition to the United States where he is at risk of penalties - including the death penalty - that the UK government is legally bound to deny.
attributes.background: Mr Julian Assange has had political asylum in the Embassy of Ecuador in London for 6 years to avoid persecution because he has exposed documents which reveal the illegal behaviour of governments including that of the United States in relation to citizen's privacy.

rejection.details:
This is a decision for the courts, which are independent of the UK Government and Parliament.

You can read more about the case here:
https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/world-affairs/europe/extradition-from-the-uk-what-next-for-julian-assange/
